clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Islet Autotransplantation Compared to Oral Antidiabetic Drug.
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Islet Autotransplantation Compared to Oral Antidiabetic Drug in Partially Pancreatectomized Patients Due to Benign Pancreatic Neoplasm.

brief_summary.textblock:
- Effects of autologous islet transplantation were compared to those of oral anti-diabetic drugs after distal pancreatectomy.
- The primary interest is a insulin-secretory function after the surgery in two intervention groups.

primary_outcome.time_frame: preop., 1 week and 1 month postop., and every 3 months after the surgery until 5 year postop.
primary_outcome.description: Insulin secretion was evaluated by calculating insulinogenic index (Δ insulin30min (μIU/ml)/Δglucose30min (mmol/L) during 75g-OGTT) and homeostasis model assessment for beta cell function (HOMA-B).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: preop., 1 week and 1 month postop., and every 3 months after the surgery until 5 year postop.
secondary_outcome.description: Glucose tolerance was evaluated by HbA1c (%), 1,5-anhydroglucitol (ug/ml), and area under the curve of glucose (75g OGTT, mg/dl*min).

clinical_study.condition: Partial Pancreatectomy Due to Benign Pancreatic Neoplasm

arm_group.description: Autologous islet transplantation arm: autologous islet transplantation
Metformin (starting from 500mg qd with dose adjustment thereafter) with or without vildagliptin (starting from 50mg qd with dose adjustment thereafter)

intervention.description: Islet was isolated from the normal part of resected pancreas with modified Ricordi method. After purification, the islets were infused into the liver through percutaneous transhepatic portal vein catheterization.

Metformin on the diagnosis of postoperative diabetes mellitus. Starting dose of 500mg per day and dose adjustment as needed to control blood glucose. Vildagliptin added on the insufficient glycemic control with monotherapy. Starting dose of 50mg per day and dose adjustment as needed to control blood glucose.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who underwent distal pancreatectomy for pathologic diagnosis of pancreatic mass
Exclusion Criteria:
- Prior history of diabetes mellitus
- Patients whose fasting, post-load (75g OGTT) glucose or HbA1c level meet ADA diagnostic criteria
- Patients who refused to participate the study
